reasoning: OI prevalence approximately 1 in 10,000-15,000 births, translating to ~6.5-7 per 100k population. Well-documented genetic disorder with clear diagnosis criteria. Reported as prevalence for chronic lifelong condition.
source: Rauch F & Glorieux FH. (2004). Osteogenesis imperfecta. Lancet. 363:1377-1385
